go.subtitle: Go
go.about: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

videos.title: Getting Started with Go
videos.description: How to setup your environment and write a Hello World application using the Go programming language.

videos.title: Go Language Basics
videos.description: In this episode Jeremy covers the basics of variables, functions and loops in Go.

nodejs.subtitle: Node.js
nodejs.about: Node.jsÂ® is a platform built on Chrome's JavaScript runtime for easily building fast, scalable network applications. Node.js uses an event-driven, non-blocking I/O model that makes it lightweight and efficient, perfect for data-intensive real-time applications that run across distributed devices.

videos.title: Introduction to Node.js
videos.description: What is Node.js and why might you want to use it?

videos.title: Node.js First Steps
videos.description: We'll learn out how to install Node.js, as well as how to maintain different Node versions using NVM. We'll also build a basic HTTP server.

ruby.subtitle: Ruby
ruby.about: Ruby is a dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.

videos.title: Ruby Version Managers
videos.description: Techniques for installing Ruby and managing different versions between applications.

videos.title: Rails Application Structure
videos.description: A look into the files and folders inside every Rails application and how they fit together.
